intro: Simira salvadorensis, commonly known as the Salvadoran simira, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
